p: Hydrolysis of ester 14 gave raise to key intermediate acid 15, that was used as key intermediate for the synthesis of amides 16â€“ 22 using standard amide bond forming conditions. Carboxylic acid 15 was also subjected to Curtius rearrangement in the presence of diphenylphosphoryl azide, triethylamine, and using tert-butanol as a solvent. The resulting Boc-amine 23 was deprotected under acidic conditions and transformed to sulphonamides 24 and 25.
